country_overview.content: Madagascar, the fourth largest island in the world, is known for its unique biodiversity, including lemurs, chameleons, and beautiful rainforests. It offers a range of tourist attractions from its national parks to stunning beaches. Madagascar requires visitors to obtain a visa prior to arrival or on arrival, depending on the nationality of the traveler. The visa system is designed to manage the influx of tourists and ensure compliance with the country's entry requirements.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa for Madagascar allows visitors to stay for up to 30 days. It is available on arrival or through the Madagascan consulates and embassies.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Travelers must have a valid passport, proof of onward travel, and sufficient funds for their stay. Visa can be obtained upon arrival or in advance from a Madagascan embassy or consulate.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of onward travel (return or onward flight ticket)
Proof of accommodation (hotel booking or invitation letter)
Evidence of sufficient funds for the duration of the stay

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the visa type that suits your purpose of travel. For most travelers, a Tourist Visa is required.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Confirm whether you can obtain the visa on arrival or need to apply in advance based on your nationality.

step_3.title: Prepare Required Documents
step_3.description: Gather all necessary documents including your passport, proof of accommodation, return flight ticket, and evidence of sufficient funds.

step_4.title: Apply for Visa
step_4.description: If applying in advance, submit your visa application to a Madagascan embassy or consulate. If applying on arrival, present your documents at the immigration counter.

step_5.title: Complete Immigration Formalities
step_5.description: Upon arrival or during application, complete all required immigration formalities and receive your Tourist Visa.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees vary depending on the duration of stay. Typically, the fee for a 30-day Tourist Visa is payable on arrival.

processing_time.content: Visa processing on arrival is immediate, while processing times for advance applications can vary depending on the embassy or consulate.

visa_validity.content: The Tourist Visa is valid for up to 30 days. Extensions may be available under certain circumstances.

entry_requirements.content: Travelers must present a valid passport, proof of onward travel, and proof of accommodation upon arrival or during application.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my Tourist Visa in Madagascar?
faq_1.answer: Extensions for Tourist Visas may be possible under certain circumstances. It is recommended to contact local immigration authorities for detailed information.

faq_2.question: Is a visa required before arrival in Madagascar?
faq_2.answer: Visas can be obtained on arrival for most nationalities, but it is advisable to check with the Madagascan embassy or consulate for specific requirements.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Madagascar on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is not allowed. For work purposes, you must apply for a work visa.
